ygData.messageBody:
Thankfully I'm not the only one to experience this!! Thanks to
everyone who commented. At the time this all happened I must have
been about 6 or 7, so I thought it was a good time to visit
BlackBurrow! Little did I know ....

It really did seem to be that no matter what anyone else was doing,
the nasty gnolls would ignore every other sitting/meditating/insulting
member of the group and head for me.

And what made it worse was when I would stand and take some beatings,
and not do anything in return, it took an age for the other members of
the group to make the gnolls even notice they were there!! Let the
wizard zap it I thought, but no that didn't seem to have an effect.

So I died a couple of times through being stunned and overwhelmed by
the 5-6 big ones who decided to jump in and help their little friends.
Thankfully I'm back on familiar home ground now and running around
Butcherblock teaching the gobbos a lesson. Maybe when I'm older I'll
resurrect the travelling spirit but for now I'm safe(ish)!


On Mon, 26 Jul 1999 13:24:56 -0500, you wrote:

>From: Brandon Kassebaum <kassebaum@...>
>
>I am going to have to back up our younger bardic friend. There is most
>definatly some bard aggro bugwhich can occur in seemingly any zone. I have
>personally experienced this super aggro in butcherblock, oasis, and unrest.
>When I was in oasis, orcs were barelling over the dunes to find me, you can see
>quite a ways in oasis so I would see several dark forms off in the distance
>beelining for me and when they got close, hey 5-6 orcs all over. What joy!
>Thank Erollisi for Selo's (the biggest lifesaver of them all) This has happened
>to me in those other zones as well... for no apparent reason, no group attacking
>anything like you suggest, things come out f the woodworks and ignore the
>medding nukers and beeline for the bard. Its disgustingly insane, even when we
>have to zone to clear the faction list.
>*sigh*
>JM, Care to comment?
>Penaden Songweaver
>http://www.lostorder.com
